Pre-Game Insights: India will take on Kuwait as Sunil Chhetri laces up his boots for the final time for the Blue Tigers.

A win would put India in a comfortable position to advance to the third round of the World Cup qualifiers and will be a fitting farewell to the legend who has scored 94 goals for the Blue Tigers in 150 appearances.
Sunil Chhetri plays his final match in a city that had shaped his career since his days as a Mohun Bagan player back in 2002-05 and then again in 2011-12.
The venue is a lucky one as well with the Indian team not having lost in the Salt Lake Stadium since August 2006.
